is expected to be a key strategy
mitigation in many countries. Passenger transport and light duty freight can already be

h more difficult and have not been addressed in most of the recent research.
In Germany, widespread electrification of private vehicles is expected by 2030
electrification of road transport is needed to reach net carbon neutrality
. In addition, novel fuels such as hydrogen, synthetic hydrocarbons and sustainable biogenic fuels
aviation and water transport to achieve net carbon neutrality
In India, electrification, hydrogen, and biofuels are key to decarbonising the transport sector

in the transport sector as key (
road to rail transport, and reduced distances travelled as other possible transport strategies
India’s transport sector strategies also include use of information technology and the

and lifestyle change along with stakeholder integration in
making are considered key to implementing new transport policies
Industrial energy efficiency improvements are considered in nearly
all countries but for countries where
industry is expected to continue to be a key sector, new and emerging technologies that require
significant R&D investment, such as hydrogen and CCS,
conventional electrical and renewable technologies, including low
renewable heat, biomass use for high
temperature heat in steel and cement sectors, and additional
electrification in glass, food and beverage, and paper and pulp indus
ncreased recycled steel for electric arc furnaces and direct electrolysis or hydrogen
